update.description:
- Re-arranged items in the left palette of the model editor as per new gazebo model editor design, [see pdf here]( #!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/d0046b3ac9795053a16cd10ab7da3bdcfae059ba/model_editor/ModelEditor_v4.pdf?at=default) 

- Also implemented new joint creation interface. Users will now create joints via a joint icon on the toolbar above the render window (previous via buttons in the left palette).

- The joint hotspot also gets a new visual representation - a cylinder with some thickness
update.title: Model editor's new joint maker interface
update.reason: user study results showed that the joint creation process is still not very intuitive so will revisit design again.

pullrequest.title: Model editor's new joint maker interface

content.raw:
@spaepcke Should we do a user study to go through @scpeters suggestions? There are three main things to think about:

1. Save the model to a filename with a timestamp suffix, e.g.  ~/defaultModel_0_yyyy-mm-dd_hh-MM-SS.sdf

2. Two clicks to select a part of a model (you mentioned this is ok in the above comment)

3. show a more obvious way to exit the model editor
content.html:
@spaepcke Should we do a user study to go through @scpeters suggestions? There are three main things to think about:

  1. Save the model to a filename with a timestamp suffix, e.g. ~/defaultModel_0_yyyy-mm-dd_hh-MM-SS.sdf

  2. Two clicks to select a part of a model (you mentioned this is ok in the above comment)

  3. show a more obvious way to exit the model editor

pullrequest.title: Model editor's new joint maker interface

content.raw: Do we have to call reset() on these shared_ptrs (visual, hotspot, parent, child)? Are not going to be destroyed after *delete joint*, and then, if they are the last pointers, the memory will be deallocated?
content.html: Do we have to call reset() on these shared_ptrs (visual, hotspot, parent, child)? Are not going to be destroyed after delete joint, and then, if they are the last pointers, the memory will be deallocated?

pull_request.title: Model editor's new joint maker interface

pullrequest.title: Model editor's new joint maker interface

content.raw: I think we could modify this->joints to use shared_ptrs instead of raw pointers. If so, we could get rid of this delete and the memory will be released in the next instruction.
content.html: I think we could modify this->joints to use shared_ptrs instead of raw pointers. If so, we could get rid of this delete and the memory will be released in the next instruction.

content.raw: How about using just local objects instead of raw pointers? It's just a test but we'll get better performance without using the heap and you can remove the delete's. You can merge it from 1c6b987 if you think it's a good idea.
content.html: How about using just local objects instead of raw pointers? It's just a test but we'll get better performance without using the heap and you can remove the delete's. You can merge it from 1c6b987 if you think it's a good idea.

content.raw:
Thanks for the feedback. I'd like to hold off for now on adding text for joint creation. We'll do some user tests a little later on, and I'm curious to see how long it takes people to figure it out. 

For the rotation, that sounds like a good idea. I'll need to have a look at it to make sure I understand correctly.
content.html:
Thanks for the feedback. I'd like to hold off for now on adding text for joint creation. We'll do some user tests a little later on, and I'm curious to see how long it takes people to figure it out.

For the rotation, that sounds like a good idea. I'll need to have a look at it to make sure I understand correctly.

pull_request.title: Model editor's new joint maker interface

pullrequest.title: Model editor's new joint maker interface

content.raw:
Looks nice, I have some general comments about the model editor that I can file tickets for if they're out of scope:

* The default file name for the model will conflict across gazebo sessions (ie. it's always `~/defaultModel_0.sdf`). How about appending a timestamp to make it unique (yyyy-mm-dd_hh-MM-SS)?

* When I click to create a joint, I didn't see any instruction on what to do (testing on my mac). Once I clicked on a part, it became highlighted, which was cool, and then a line appeared that snapped towards other parts. I like that, but maybe there could be some text somewhere that says when to click a particular thing?

* It would be nice to be able to move or rotate individual links relative to each other. I'd like to rotate some cylinders onto their sides to make them wheels, but the rotation tool acts on the whole model.

* Screw joints need a non-zero value of the `thread_pitch` parameter to be set.

cc: @spaepcke in case you're interested.
content.html:
Looks nice, I have some general comments about the model editor that I can file tickets for if they're out of scope:

  • The default file name for the model will conflict across gazebo sessions (ie. it's always ~/defaultModel_0.sdf). How about appending a timestamp to make it unique (yyyy-mm-dd_hh-MM-SS)?

  • When I click to create a joint, I didn't see any instruction on what to do (testing on my mac). Once I clicked on a part, it became highlighted, which was cool, and then a line appeared that snapped towards other parts. I like that, but maybe there could be some text somewhere that says when to click a particular thing?

  • It would be nice to be able to move or rotate individual links relative to each other. I'd like to rotate some cylinders onto their sides to make them wheels, but the rotation tool acts on the whole model.

  • Screw joints need a non-zero value of the thread_pitch parameter to be set.

cc: @spaepcke in case you're interested.
